result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Pete Bates

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 12-7-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Willie Pete Bates.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they are still awaiting discovery materials from the State. Defense, further requests an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Br 10.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant has a new felony case pending.  Case is adjourned to 9-16-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ruby De Leon in court, defendant Willie Pete Bates not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-19-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Denise R. S.;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Pete Bates in court with attorney Julita Kishma de Leon.  Defendant Willie Pete Bates in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Pete Bates appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
